2021-10-02.name: Big Island Rendezvous and Festival
2021-10-02.summary: This southern Minnesota festival is great for families, with a voyageur encampment of more than 1,000 reenactors dancing, demonstrating, competing and pulling visitors back into the fur-trade era.

2021-10-02.name: Autumn on Parade
2021-10-02.summary: Strolling performers appear at the Autumn on Parade Festival, and the Harvest Time Parade is on Sunday.

2021-10-02.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2021-10-02.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2021-10-02.name: CelebrAsian Asian Heritage Festival
2021-10-02.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features such activities as martial arts, lion dancers,  chopstick races, a fashion show and, of course, food.

2021-10-02.name: Northside Oktoberfest
2021-10-02.summary: The Iowa City Brewfest is part of this festival, which includes keg  bowling, beer sliding and nail-striking as well as traditional Oktoberfest music in an outdoor beer hall.

2021-10-02.name: Autumnfest
2021-10-02.summary: This town on the St. Croix River offers live music, a car show, food trucks and an arts and crafts fair in Overlook Park.

2021-10-03.name: Big Island Rendezvous and Festival
2021-10-03.summary: This southern Minnesota festival is great for families, with a voyageur encampment of more than 1,000 reenactors dancing, demonstrating, competing and pulling visitors back into the fur-trade era.

2021-10-03.name: Autumn on Parade
2021-10-03.summary: Strolling performers appear at the Autumn on Parade Festival, and the Harvest Time Parade is on Sunday.

2021-10-18.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2021-10-18.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-19.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2021-10-19.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-20.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2021-10-20.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-21.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2021-10-21.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-21.name: Wisconsin Book Festival
2021-10-21.summary: This big fest features readings, lectures, book discussions, writing workshops, live interviews and children's events.

2021-10-22.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2021-10-22.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-22.name: Wisconsin Book Festival
2021-10-22.summary: This big fest features readings, lectures, book discussions, writing workshops, live interviews and children's events.

2021-10-23.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2021-10-23.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-23.name: Wisconsin Book Festival
2021-10-23.summary: This big fest features readings, lectures, book discussions, writing workshops, live interviews and children's events.

2021-10-23.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-23.summary: Carlos Creek Winery's brewing partner, 22 Northmen, hosts this festival, which includes a stein-holding contest, pumpkin throwing, horse-drawn wagon rides and live bands.

2021-10-23.name: Pumpkin Chuckin Fest
2021-10-23.summary: The festival in this town, just west of Racine, features a pumpkin catapult contest, barbecue cook-off, pie auction, pumpkin-baking contest, children's games and music.

2021-10-23.name: Scarecrow Festival
2021-10-23.summary: This town in northwest Illinois offers scarecrow and doughnut-eating contests, pumpkin racing, a petting zoo and a band concert.

2021-10-24.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2021-10-24.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-24.name: Wisconsin Book Festival
2021-10-24.summary: This big fest features readings, lectures, book discussions, writing workshops, live interviews and children's events.

2021-10-24.name: Witches & Wizards of Woodstock
2021-10-24.summary: This all-ages fantasy festival in Woodstock Square features a magical talking hat, Quidditch training, an owlery, a wandering magician, a cosplay scavenger hunt and a costume parade and contest.

2021-10-01.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2021-10-01.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2021-10-01.name: CelebrAsian Asian Heritage Festival
2021-10-01.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features such activities as martial arts, lion dancers,  chopstick races, a fashion show and, of course, food.

2021-10-09.name: Madison County Covered Bridge Festival
2021-10-09.summary: John Wayne was born there, George Washington Carver lived there and the famous covered bridges still are there. The festival in this town southwest of Des Moines features guided bus tours to the bridges, free horse-drawn wagon rides to Wayne's house, Old West shootouts, live music and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2021-10-09.name: Civil War Immersion Weekend at Norskedalen
2021-10-09.summary: This pioneer farmstead in the coulees southeast of La Crosse is wonderfully atmospheric, and the crackerjack re-enactors of the Second Wisconsin Volunteer Infantry's Company B give the region's most affecting portrayal of war.

2021-10-09.name: Pumpkin Patch Festival
2021-10-09.summary: There'll be music, children's games and arts and crafts in this Door County village.

2021-10-09.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-09.summary: There will be music, food and free pumpkins on downtown streets.

2021-10-09.name: Shadows of the Blue and Gray
2021-10-09.summary: This Civil War festival off I-80, half an hour west of Starved Rock  State Park, includes battle re-enactments both days.

2021-10-10.name: Madison County Covered Bridge Festival
2021-10-10.summary: John Wayne was born there, George Washington Carver lived there and the famous covered bridges still are there. The festival in this town southwest of Des Moines features guided bus tours to the bridges, free horse-drawn wagon rides to Wayne's house, Old West shootouts, live music and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2021-10-10.name: Pumpkin Patch Festival
2021-10-10.summary: There'll be music, children's games and arts and crafts in this Door County village.

2021-10-10.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-10.summary: There will be music, food and free pumpkins on downtown streets.

2021-10-10.name: Shadows of the Blue and Gray
2021-10-10.summary: This Civil War festival off I-80, half an hour west of Starved Rock  State Park, includes battle re-enactments both days.

2021-10-10.name: Harvest Fest
2021-10-10.summary: See old-time artisanry at the Swiss Historical Village, including sausage-stuffing and cheese-making in the 1890s cheese factory.

2021-10-29.name: Mystery at the Fur Post
2021-10-29.summary: Unmask the phantom stalking the big top during "The Circus Returns'' at the             re-created Snake River (formerly North West Company) Fur Post, an hour north of the Twin Cities. The program is family-friendly, and reservations are recommended.

2021-10-29.name: Halloween Parade & Festival
2021-10-29.summary: There will be a hot-air balloon glow Friday, kids' activities and the town's annual parade along Main Street at 6:30 p.m.

2021-10-29.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2021-10-29.summary: There will be mask making, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and haunted trolley tours.

2021-10-29.name: Zombie Days
2021-10-29.summary: Zombies will take over this town on Chequamegon Bay, and there are also carved-pumpkin, costume and house-decorating contests, a ghost hunt and a drive-in movie.

2021-10-30.name: Mystery at the Fur Post
2021-10-30.summary: Unmask the phantom stalking the big top during "The Circus Returns'' at the             re-created Snake River (formerly North West Company) Fur Post, an hour north of the Twin Cities. The program is family-friendly, and reservations are recommended.

2021-10-30.name: Halloween Parade & Festival
2021-10-30.summary: There will be a hot-air balloon glow Friday, kids' activities and the town's annual parade along Main Street at 6:30 p.m.

2021-10-30.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2021-10-30.summary: There will be mask making, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and haunted trolley tours.

2021-10-30.name: Zombie Days
2021-10-30.summary: Zombies will take over this town on Chequamegon Bay, and there are also carved-pumpkin, costume and house-decorating contests, a ghost hunt and a drive-in movie.

2021-10-30.name: UFO Day
2021-10-30.summary: There's a craft fair, kids' games and a Forbidden Forest, but the 1 p.m. parade is the main event in this riverside village just south of Madison, where residents reported more than a dozen UFO sightings in the winter of 1987.

2021-10-30.name: BatFest
2021-10-30.summary: This Fox River town hosts a pumpkin roll, pumpkin-carving battles, "Thriller'' dances, marshmallow shooting and a parade.

2021-10-30.name: Mount Carroll Pumpkin Fest
2021-10-30.summary: In this northwest Illinois town, there will be a costume parade, pumpkin bowling, pumpkin slingshot and pumpkin street drag races.

2021-10-30.name: Day of the Dead Xicago
2021-10-30.summary: In the National Museum of Mexican Art and Harrison Park, families can create ofrendas (altars), eat pan de muerto, listen to musical performances and get faces painted. Admission is free.

2021-10-30.name: Day of the Dead
2021-10-30.summary: In Old Town Mankato along Riverfront Drive, there will be a mariachi band, Aztec and folklore dancers, a makers' market, food trucks and children's activities and treats.

2021-10-31.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2021-10-31.summary: There will be mask making, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and haunted trolley tours.

2021-10-31.name: Zombie Days
2021-10-31.summary: Zombies will take over this town on Chequamegon Bay, and there are also carved-pumpkin, costume and house-decorating contests, a ghost hunt and a drive-in movie.

2021-10-31.name: Halloween Outdoor Puppet Extravaganza
2021-10-31.summary: This year, the larger-than-life puppetry troupe will collaborate on The Cry of the Ancestors, a community pageant procession from Powderhorn Park, followed by concerts and cabaret. Free, with donations requested.

2021-10-16.name: Open House Chicago
2021-10-16.summary: The Chicago Architecture Foundation sponsors this free, behind-the-scenes peek at more than 200 mansions, clubs,  churches, hotels and theaters.

2021-10-16.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-16.summary: This downtown festival near Lake Geneva features wine and beer tasting, music, a car show, arts and crafts and a chili cookoff.

2021-10-17.name: Open House Chicago
2021-10-17.summary: The Chicago Architecture Foundation sponsors this free, behind-the-scenes peek at more than 200 mansions, clubs,  churches, hotels and theaters.
